values.name: Integrity
values.definition: Adhering to moral and ethical principles; being honest and truthful in all interactions.

values.name: Growth
values.definition: Continuous self-improvement and development, both personally and professionally.

values.name: Curiosity
values.definition: Eagerness to explore, discover, and learn new things with an open mind.

values.name: Simplicity
values.definition: Embracing clarity, minimalism, and focusing on what truly matters.

values.name: Authenticity
values.definition: Being true to oneself and others; not pretending to be something you're not.

values.name: Independence
values.definition: Self-reliance and freedom to make your own choices and decisions.

values.name: Resilience
values.definition: The ability to recover quickly from difficulties, adapt, and grow stronger through challenges.

values.name: Discipline
values.definition: Maintaining order and control in your actions, habits, and lifestyle.

values.name: Balance
values.definition: Harmoniously integrating various aspects of life without overemphasizing any one area.

values.name: Humor
values.definition: Finding joy and laughter in life, even during difficult times.

values.name: Health
values.definition: Prioritizing physical and mental wellbeing through conscious choices.

values.name: Wisdom
values.definition: Seeking deeper understanding, good judgment, and insight beyond mere knowledge.

values.name: Creativity
values.definition: Using imagination and original ideas to create something meaningful.

values.name: Courage
values.definition: Facing fears and challenges with strength and determination.

values.name: Love
values.definition: Deep affection, care, and connection with others; willingness to be vulnerable.

values.name: Honesty
values.definition: Being truthful and sincere in all relationships and communications.

values.name: Empathy
values.definition: Understanding and sharing the feelings of others; seeing from their perspective.

values.name: Loyalty
values.definition: Remaining faithful, supportive, and committed to people who matter to you.

values.name: Trust
values.definition: Believing in the reliability, truth, and capability of others.

values.name: Respect
values.definition: Treating others with consideration, appreciation, and dignity.

values.name: Communication
values.definition: Open and clear exchange of thoughts, feelings, and needs with others.

values.name: Forgiveness
values.definition: Letting go of resentment and anger; offering second chances.

values.name: Compassion
values.definition: Showing kindness and concern for the suffering or misfortunes of others.

values.name: Generosity
values.definition: Giving freely of your time, resources, or attention without expecting return.

values.name: Family
values.definition: Prioritizing connections with relatives and creating a supportive home environment.

values.name: Friendship
values.definition: Valuing and nurturing close, non-romantic relationships based on mutual affection.

values.name: Vulnerability
values.definition: Willingness to be open about weaknesses, flaws, and emotions with trusted others.

values.name: Achievement
values.definition: Accomplishing goals and receiving recognition for your efforts and success.

values.name: Innovation
values.definition: Creating new ideas, methods, or solutions; being forward-thinking.

values.name: Impact
values.definition: Making a meaningful difference through your work and contributions.

values.name: Learning
values.definition: Continually acquiring new knowledge, skills, and insights in your field.

values.name: Leadership
values.definition: Guiding, influencing, and inspiring others toward a common goal or vision.

values.name: Excellence
values.definition: Striving for the highest quality and standards in your work.

values.name: Collaboration
values.definition: Working effectively with others to create better outcomes than possible alone.

values.name: Challenge
values.definition: Seeking difficult problems that stretch your abilities and stimulate growth.

values.name: Autonomy
values.definition: Having freedom and independence in how you approach your work.

values.name: Financial Security
values.definition: Earning enough to meet your needs and provide stability for yourself and loved ones.

values.name: Recognition
values.definition: Being acknowledged and appreciated for your contributions and achievements.

values.name: Competition
values.definition: Striving to outperform others or previous standards; being the best.

values.name: Mentorship
values.definition: Guiding others in their development; sharing knowledge and experience.

values.name: Mastery
values.definition: Becoming highly skilled and knowledgeable in your chosen field.

values.name: Justice
values.definition: Promoting fairness, equality, and moral rightness in society.

values.name: Service
values.definition: Contributing to the welfare of others, communities, or causes.

values.name: Equity
values.definition: Ensuring fair treatment, access, and advancement for all people.

values.name: Sustainability
values.definition: Making choices that protect the environment and future generations.

values.name: Community
values.definition: Building and maintaining meaningful connections with a group of people.

values.name: Responsibility
values.definition: Taking ownership of your actions and their impact on others and society.

values.name: Inclusion
values.definition: Embracing diversity and ensuring everyone feels welcomed and valued.

values.name: Tradition
values.definition: Respecting and maintaining cultural practices, beliefs, and customs.

values.name: Citizenship
values.definition: Actively participating in and contributing to the civic life of your community.

values.name: Legacy
values.definition: Creating a lasting positive impact that extends beyond your lifetime.

values.name: Philanthropy
values.definition: Promoting welfare of others through charitable giving and good works.

values.name: Connection
values.definition: Experiencing oneness or relationship with something larger than yourself.

values.name: Grace
values.definition: Extending kindness and forgiveness beyond what might seem deserved.

values.name: Mindfulness
values.definition: Being fully present and engaged in the current moment.

values.name: Wonder
values.definition: Maintaining a sense of awe and appreciation for life's mysteries.

values.name: Faith
values.definition: Believing in something beyond the material world or empirical evidence.

values.name: Gratitude
values.definition: Appreciating and acknowledging the good in your life.

values.name: Harmony
values.definition: Seeking peaceful coexistence and alignment with others and nature.

values.name: Purpose
values.definition: Living with a sense of meaning and direction beyond self-interest.

values.name: Transcendence
values.definition: Experiences that go beyond ordinary limits or material existence.

values.name: Presence
values.definition: Being fully engaged in the here and now, without distraction.

values.name: Serenity
values.definition: Finding inner peace and calm regardless of external circumstances.

values.name: Freedom
values.definition: Living without restrictions or constraints; self-determination.

values.name: Risk-taking
values.definition: Willingness to step outside your comfort zone and face uncertainty.

values.name: Discovery
values.definition: Exploring new places, ideas, or experiences with an open mind.

values.name: Play
values.definition: Engaging in activities for pure enjoyment rather than practical purpose.

values.name: Spontaneity
values.definition: Embracing unplanned experiences and going with the flow.

values.name: Adventure
values.definition: Seeking exciting, novel experiences outside of routine life.

values.name: Variety
values.definition: Experiencing different activities, environments, and relationships.

values.name: Thrill
values.definition: Pursuing experiences that create excitement or exhilaration.

values.name: Novelty
values.definition: Seeking new and different experiences, ideas, or possessions.

values.name: Exploration
values.definition: Investigating and discovering new territories, ideas, or possibilities.

reflections.Integrity: How do you honor your integrity when faced with difficult choices?
reflections.Growth: In what area of your life are you currently experiencing the most growth?
reflections.Curiosity: What questions are you currently exploring in your life?
reflections.Simplicity: Where could you bring more simplicity into your daily routine?
reflections.Authenticity: When do you feel most authentic and true to yourself?
reflections.Independence: How do you balance independence with connection to others?
reflections.Resilience: What challenge has most strengthened your resilience?
reflections.Discipline: What daily disciplines serve your highest goals?
reflections.Balance: Which areas of your life need more attention to create better balance?
reflections.Humor: How does humor help you navigate life's challenges?
reflections.Health: What one habit could you change to better honor your health?
reflections.Wisdom: What life experience has taught you the most valuable wisdom?
reflections.Creativity: How do you express your creativity in everyday life?
reflections.Courage: What courageous conversation or action is calling you now?
reflections.Love: How do you express love to the important people in your life?
reflections.Honesty: Where do you find it most challenging to be completely honest?
reflections.Empathy: When have you most deeply understood someone else's perspective?
reflections.Loyalty: How do you demonstrate loyalty in your relationships?
reflections.Trust: What helps you build or rebuild trust with others?
reflections.Respect: How do you show respect to people with different views than yours?
reflections.Communication: What one change could improve your most important communications?
reflections.Forgiveness: Who might benefit from your forgiveness right now?
reflections.Compassion: How do you practice self-compassion when you make mistakes?
reflections.Generosity: In what ways do you express generosity beyond material giving?
reflections.Family: What family tradition or value is most meaningful to you?
reflections.Friendship: What qualities do you most value in your closest friendships?
reflections.Vulnerability: When did being vulnerable lead to a deeper connection?
reflections.Achievement: What achievement are you currently working toward?
reflections.Innovation: How do you cultivate innovative thinking in your work?
reflections.Impact: What impact do you hope to have through your work?
reflections.Learning: What new skill or knowledge are you currently developing?
reflections.Leadership: How would you describe your leadership philosophy?
reflections.Excellence: In what area do you strive for excellence rather than perfection?
reflections.Collaboration: What makes collaboration successful for you?
reflections.Challenge: What challenging goal is currently stretching you?
reflections.Autonomy: How much autonomy do you need to do your best work?
reflections.Financial Security: What does financial security mean in your life?
reflections.Recognition: What form of recognition is most meaningful to you?
reflections.Competition: How does healthy competition improve your performance?
reflections.Mentorship: Who has been a significant mentor in your life?
reflections.Mastery: What skill or subject are you currently mastering?
reflections.Justice: How do you stand up for justice in your daily life?
reflections.Service: How do you serve others or your community?
reflections.Equity: What inequities do you feel called to address?
reflections.Sustainability: What sustainable practices do you prioritize?
reflections.Community: How do you contribute to building community?
reflections.Responsibility: What responsibility do you take most seriously?
reflections.Inclusion: How do you create inclusive environments?
reflections.Tradition: What traditions give meaning to your life?
reflections.Citizenship: How do you express your citizenship?
reflections.Legacy: What legacy do you hope to leave?
reflections.Philanthropy: How do you practice philanthropy in your life?
reflections.Connection: When do you feel most spiritually connected?
reflections.Grace: How do you extend grace to yourself and others?
reflections.Mindfulness: What mindfulness practices support your wellbeing?
reflections.Wonder: What fills you with a sense of wonder?
reflections.Faith: How does faith guide your decisions?
reflections.Gratitude: What are you most grateful for right now?
reflections.Harmony: Where do you find harmony in your life?
reflections.Purpose: What gives you a sense of purpose?
reflections.Presence: How do you practice being fully present?
reflections.Serenity: What brings you serenity during difficult times?
reflections.Freedom: How do you express your freedom in daily life?
reflections.Risk-taking: What calculated risk might be worth taking?
reflections.Discovery: What recent discovery has excited you?
reflections.Play: How do you incorporate play into your adult life?
reflections.Spontaneity: When did spontaneity lead to an unexpected joy?
reflections.Adventure: What adventure are you currently planning or dreaming about?
reflections.Variety: How do you bring variety into your routine?
reflections.Thrill: What thrilling experience has taught you something about yourself?
reflections.Novelty: How do you satisfy your desire for novelty?
reflections.Exploration: What are you currently exploring in your life?
